subject: english
source: Uganda National Curriculum Development Centre (NCDC) - P3 Thematic Curriculum

themes.name: Our Sub-county/Division
competences: Read texts about local communities with understanding
Write descriptive paragraphs about the community
Identify main ideas and supporting details in texts
Use correct subject-verb agreement
Spell multi-syllable words correctly
Listen to descriptions of places and understand details
Give presentations about community features
Use geographical vocabulary appropriately
Read and create simple maps with place names
Write simple news reports about community events

themes.name: Livelihood in Our Sub-county/Division
competences: Read occupational descriptions with comprehension
Write about different livelihoods in the community
Use past and present tenses correctly
Spell occupational and business-related words
Listen to interviews about work and livelihood
Speak about career aspirations clearly
Read and write business-related vocabulary
Use adjectives to describe work environments
Create job advertisements and application letters
Write stories about economic activities

themes.name: Our Environment in Our Sub-county/Division
competences: Read environmental texts with understanding
Write about environmental features and resources
Use descriptive language for environmental features
Spell environmental and geographical words correctly
Listen to environmental explanations and take notes
Speak about environmental conservation practices
Read and create descriptions of landscapes
Use comparative and superlative adjectives
Write persuasive texts about conservation
Create environmental awareness posters

themes.name: Environment and Weather
competences: Read weather reports and understand information
Write descriptions of weather and seasons
Use adverbs to describe weather conditions
Spell weather-related vocabulary correctly
Listen to weather forecasts and understand predictions
Give descriptions of seasonal changes
Read and understand weather symbols and codes
Write about seasonal activities and clothing
Create weather journals with observations
Write poetry about seasons and weather

themes.name: Living Things: Animals
competences: Read animal descriptions and information texts
Write fact files about different animals
Use present tense for animal behaviors
Spell animal names and characteristics correctly
Listen to stories and documentaries about animals
Describe animals using varied adjectives
Read and understand animal classification texts
Write about animal habitats and adaptation
Create informative texts about endangered species
Write imaginative stories from animal perspectives

themes.name: Living Things: Plants
competences: Read texts about plants and their characteristics
Write descriptions of plant growth and parts
Use correct terminology for plant structures
Spell plant-related vocabulary accurately
Listen to explanations of plant life cycles
Describe plant adaptations to environments
Read and understand botany-related texts
Write about plant uses in daily life
Create illustrated guides to local plants
Write informative texts about plant conservation

themes.name: Water and Natural Resources
competences: Read texts about water sources and conservation
Write about water and natural resource management
Use technical vocabulary related to resources
Spell water and resource-related words correctly
Listen to conservation messages and understand importance
Speak persuasively about conservation practices
Read and understand environmental policies
Write about water-related challenges and solutions
Create awareness campaigns for conservation
Write research reports on natural resources

themes.name: Cultural Heritage
competences: Read about cultural practices and traditions
Write descriptions of cultural events and customs
Use culturally appropriate vocabulary and expressions
Spell cultural and traditional words correctly
Listen to stories of cultural significance
Speak about cultural traditions respectfully
Read and understand historical narratives
Write about cultural values and their importance
Create written records of family traditions
Write poetry reflecting cultural identity

themes.name: Peace, Rights and Responsibilities
competences: Read texts about rights, responsibilities and peace
Write about human rights and civic duties
Use vocabulary related to democracy and rights
Spell terms related to justice and governance
Listen to discussions about peace and conflict
Speak about rights and responsibilities clearly
Read constitutions and rights documents
Write persuasive texts promoting peace
Create awareness campaigns about human rights
Write reflective texts about personal responsibilities

themes.name: Energy and Movement
competences: Read texts about energy, forces and motion
Write about physical activities and energy use
Use technical vocabulary for energy and forces
Spell science-related words correctly
Listen to explanations of scientific concepts
Describe movements and forces clearly
Read and understand scientific diagrams
Write experiment reports with observations
Create illustrated explanations of movement
Write about practical applications of forces

themes.name: Communication and Technology
competences: Read texts about communication and technology
Write about communication methods and technology
Use technology-related vocabulary appropriately
Spell technical terms correctly
Listen to explanations of communication systems
Speak about technology use in daily life
Read and understand technology instructions
Write about benefits and risks of technology
Create digital texts using appropriate tools
Write persuasive texts about technology use

themes.name: Trade and Commerce
competences: Read business and economic texts with understanding
Write about trade, business and commerce
Use business and economic terminology correctly
Spell commercial and trade-related words
Listen to business and market discussions
Speak about economic activities confidently
Read and understand business documents
Write about entrepreneurship and business ideas
Create business proposals and plans
Write case studies of local businesses and traders

learning_outcomes: Read fluently and comprehensively across varied text types
Write coherent multi-sentence texts with clear purpose
Use correct grammar, spelling and punctuation consistently
Communicate effectively in English for various purposes
Listen attentively and understand spoken English in various contexts
Speak clearly and confidently on diverse topics
Develop critical thinking through reading and discussion
Appreciate English language and develop lifelong reading habits
